comments:
The course requires a prerequisite of PHYS 240 or 250. It discusses temperature, entropy and generalized potentials, phase transitions, ensemble theory, and distribution functions.

Students found the course generally to be a disappointment. Some felt the class got caught up in details and did not have time to cover important concepts.  One student commented that the content was too theoretical, without much connection to physical meaning. 

Many students felt Dr. Liu had trouble communicating the material and could have created a more organized course. Most felt she was a nice person but was unavailable for additional help outside of class. 

 Students generally felt the exams were extremely difficult. This course also had a considerable amount of homework, which took “too much time” and was often confusing.
